english: One good turn deserves another.
japanese: 情けは人のためならず

english: A friend to all is a friend to none.
japanese: 八方美人頼むに足らず

english: He who runs after two hares will catch neither.
japanese: 二兎を追う者は一兎をも得ず

english: He that falls today may rise tomorrow.
japanese: 沈む瀬あれば浮かぶ瀬あり

english: Prevention is better than cure.
It's no use crying over spilt milk.
Time and tide wait for no man.
Don't teach your grandmother to suck eggs.
As the boy, so the man.
Where there's smoke, there's fire.
japanese: 火のない所に煙は立たぬ

english: Nothing costs so much as what is given us.
japanese: ただより高いものはない

english: When one door shuts another opens.
japanese: 捨てる神あれば拾う神あり

english: Make haste slowly.
Seeing is believing.
After a storm comes a calm.
Kill two birds with one stone.
Money comes and goes.
Repentance comes too late.
Out of the mouth comes evil.
Done is better than perfect.
japanese: 完璧を目指すよりまず終わらせろ

english: It is like beating the air.
Second thoughts are best.
Appearances are deceptive.
japanese: 人は見かけによらぬもの

english: Good fortune and happiness will come to the home of those who smile.
Attack is the best form of defense.
japanese: 攻撃は最大の防御なり

english: Lend your money and lose your friend.
Talk of the devil and he will appear.
Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
japanese: 虎穴（こけつ）に入らずんば虎子（こじ）を得ず

english: Even a worm will turn.
japanese: 一寸の虫にも五分の魂

english: What one likes, one will do well.
japanese: 好きこそものの上手なれ

english: When the cat's away, the mice will play.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.
japanese: 転がる石には苔が生えぬ

english: So many men, so many minds.
All roads lead to Rome.
japanese: すべての道はローマに通ず

english: Don't count your chickens before they are hatched.
Easier said than done.
japanese: 言うは易く行うは難し

english: Do your best and leave the rest to Providence.
japanese: 人事を尽くして天命を待つ

english: Pride will have a fall.
japanese: 驕（おご）れる者久しからず

english: Rome was not built in a day.
japanese: ローマは一日にして成らず

english: A drowning man will catch at a straw.
japanese: おぼれる者はわらをもつかむ

english: Perseverance will win in the end.
Strike while the iron is hot.
An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth.
japanese: 目には目を、歯には歯を

english: Let sleeping dogs lie.
A wise man changes his mind, a fool never.
Time is money.
Manners know distance.
japanese: 親しき仲にも礼儀あり

english: Practice makes perfect.
Good medicine tastes bitter.
He that will lie will steal.
japanese: 嘘つきは泥棒の始まり

english: He who shoots often, hits at last.
japanese: 下手な鉄砲も数撃ちゃ当たる

english: Failure teaches success.
What happens twice will happen three times.
japanese: 二度あることは三度ある

english: Many a little makes a mickle.
japanese: 塵も積もれば山となる

english: A bad carpenter quarrels with his tools.
Set a thief to catch a thief.
The early bird catches the worm.
Fact is stranger than fiction.
japanese: 事実は小説よりも奇なり

english: A word to the wise is enough.
A sound mind in a sound body.
japanese: 健全なる精神は健全なる身体に宿る

english: History repeats itself.
Speech is silver, silence is gold.
Losers are always in the wrong.
japanese: 勝てば官軍、負ければ賊軍

english: When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
Two heads are better than one.
japanese: 三人寄れば文殊の知恵

english: Birds of a feather flock together.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
japanese: まさかの時の友こそ真の友

english: Third time lucky.
Too much is as bad as too little.
japanese: 過ぎたるはなお及ばざるがごとし

english: Like father, like son.
Names and natures often agree.
Don't kick against the pricks.
japanese: 長いものには巻かれろ

english: Misfortunes never come singly.
Better be the head of an ass than the tail of a horse.
japanese: 鶏口となるも牛後となるなかれ

english: Tomorrow is another day.
japanese: 明日は明日の風が吹く

english: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
japanese: 船頭多くして船山に上る

english: Homer sometimes nods.
Spare the rod and spoil the child.
japanese: 可愛い子には旅をさせよ

english: Give him an inch and he'll tale a mile.
japanese: 庇（ひさし）を貸して母屋を取られる

english: Everything comes to him who waits.
japanese: 待てば海路の日和（ひより）あり

english: There is no accounting for tastes.
japanese: 蓼（たで）食う虫も好き好き

english: Bad money drives out good.
japanese: 悪貨は良貨を駆逐する

english: So many countries, so many customs.
All's well that ends well.
japanese: 終わり良ければすべて良し

english: Bread is better than the songs of birds.
Stoop to conquer.
Despair gives courage to a coward.
japanese: 窮鼠（きゅうそ）猫を噛（か）む

english: Easy come, easy go.
Out of sight, out of mind.
japanese: 去る者は日々に疎（うと）し

english: Every man has his faults.
Long life has long misery.
He that touches pitch shall be defiled.
japanese: 朱に交われば赤くなる

english: Haste makes waste.
japanese: 急いては事を仕損ずる

english: Anything is better than nothing.
No news is good news.
japanese: 便りのないのは良い便り

english: There are no birds in last year's nest.
japanese: 柳の下にいつもどじょうはいない

english: Necessity is the mother of invention.
A wonder lasts but nine days.
Bad news travels fast.
Home is where you make it.
